extraction_details.evidence: Use of lucicebtide (ST101) in glioblastoma patients by antagonism of C/EBP?-dependent mesenchymal cell transition

Lucicebtide.reasoning: The abstract title explicitly identifies lucicebtide as an antagonist of C/EBPβ. Following Rule 1, since the drug class is mentioned in the title, it is prioritized and extracted as the primary class. Rule 11 and Rule 13 are applied to format the target and modality as 'C/EBPβ Antagonist'. Rule 3 is applied for Title Case.
